TwinSharp

IpcDisplayDevice Public class

Description

The IpcDisplayDevice class provides an interface to interact with a display device connected via TwinCAT ADS. It allows reading and writing various properties of the display such as active display mode, display mode description, primary display status, COM port, version, brightness, and light enabled status. It also provides a method to save the brightness setting persistently across power cycles.

byte ActiveDisplayModeID
ID of active display mode		 get, set
uint Brightness
Valid values: 20-100 (20 lowest brightness, 100 maximum brightness)		 get, set
string ComPort
Windows Embedded Standard (WES): e.g. "Com4"
Windows CE: under Windows CE, the Com Port must end with a colon, e.g. "COM4:"		 get, set
string DisplayModeDescription
Description of active display mode		 get
bool IsPrimaryDisplay
True if this display is the primary display		 get
bool LightEnabled
Valid values: TRUE = background light ON, FALSE = background light OFF		 get, set
uint Version
Version of the display device		 get

Details

Summary

The IpcDisplayDevice class provides an interface to interact with a display device connected via TwinCAT ADS. It allows reading and writing various properties of the display such as active display mode, display mode description, primary display status, COM port, version, brightness, and light enabled status. It also provides a method to save the brightness setting persistently across power cycles.
